abstract: Japan's Fukui District Court lifts injunction against two nuclear reactors run by Kansai Electric Power Company; operator obtained approval of safety regulators and support from local leaders in spite of fears of repeat disaster like Fukushima in 2011.
lead_paragraph: The court lifted an April injunction that was filed by residents who said that an earthquake exceeding the reactors’ quake resistance could cause a disaster similar to the crisis set off by a March 2011 quake and tsunami.

headline.main: Japan: Court Paves Way for Utility to Restart 2 More Nuclear Reactors
headline.print_headline: Asia; Japan: Court Paves Way for Utility to Restart 2 More Nuclear Reactors

snippet: The court lifted an April injunction that was filed by residents who said that an earthquake exceeding the reactors’ quake resistance could cause a disaster similar to the crisis set off by a March 2011 quake and tsunami.
